com.beepell.xml.namespace
Class DocumentNamespaceContext

java.lang.Object
  com.beepell.xml.namespace.DocumentNamespaceContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
NamespaceContext
public class DocumentNamespaceContext
extends Object
implements NamespaceContext

Namespace context to resolve namespace declarations. Please note: Because this implementation is adding complete documents, either DOM or files, it does not support shadowing, this is, overlapping, namespace declarations. This comes naturally from the fact, that the interface does not know for which node it is resolving names.

Author:
Tim Hallwyl, 2006, 2007

Constructor Detail

DocumentNamespaceContext

public DocumentNamespaceContext()
Create an empty namespace context based on DOM documents.

DocumentNamespaceContext

public DocumentNamespaceContext(Document document)
                         throws XPathExpressionException
Create a namespace context based on a document. This requires that the document is using uniform namespace prefixes. That is, a namespace prefix, for example "bpel", may only be declared once. According to the XML standard, namespace declarations may shadow, but this is not supported using this approach.

Parameters:
document -
Throws:
XPathExpressionException

DocumentNamespaceContext

public DocumentNamespaceContext(File file)
                         throws XPathExpressionException,
                                ParserConfigurationException,
                                SAXException,
                                IOException
Creates a namespace context bases on a file. The file is parsed and added as a DOM tree. See NamespaceContext(Document document) for restrictions.

Parameters:
file -

XPathExpressionException

add

public void add(File file)
         throws ParserConfigurationException,
                SAXException,
                IOException,

Adds all namespace declarations in the file to the context. Overlapping prefixes will replace existing declarations.
